  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",

  "Broker Comment" : "CUSTOMER WROTE LETTER TO INSURANCE CARRIER ASKING FOR FULL SURRENDER/REFUND OF HIS VARIABLE ANNUITY CLAIMING UNSUITABILITY.  FIRM CONDUCTED INVESTIGATION AND FOUND THAT REP HAD EXPLAINED THE PRODUCT IN DETAIL, HAD PROVIDED ALL APPLICABLE DISCLOSURES WHICH CLIENT SIGNED AND ACKNOWLEDGED, AND HAD PROVIDED CUSTOMER WITH COPIES OF ALL PAPERWORK AND PROSPECTUSES.  PRODUCT APPEARED TOTALLY SUITABLE BASED ON INCOME AND DEATH BENEFIT GUARANTEE RIDERS INCLUDED WHICH WERE UNAVAILABLE IN HIS PRIOR RETIREMENT PROGRAM. CONTRACT HAD PERFORMED SO THAT THERE WAS A SMALL GAIN INCLUDING THE WITHDRAWALS TAKEN.  FIRM DENIED CLAIM."
}

OTHER_NAMES: [JOE DAVID MYERS JR, JOE DAVID MYERS SR, JOE DAVID MYERS]
DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT OPENED A DISCRETIONARY ADVISORY ACCOUNT, WHICH HAS INCURRED LOSSES IN THE RECENT MARKET DOWNTURN.  DISSATISFIED WITH THE PERFORMANCE, CLIENT HAS NOW ALLEGED THAT REP FAILED TO FOLLOW HIS INSTRUCTIONS IN THAT THE REP WAS TO CALL HIM WHEN TRADES OCCURRED IN HIS ACCOUNT.",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "CUSTOMER EXPERIENCED A DECLINE IN THE MARKET VALUE OF HIS DISCRETIONARY MANAGED ADVISORY ACCOUNTS AND ASKED REP TO MAKE HIM WHOLE.  WHEN REP DECLINED, CUSTOMER HAD HIS ATTORNEY SEND A LETTER ALLUDING TO A SUPPOSED TRADE RESTRICTION REQUEST BY THE CUSTOMER.  FIRM CONDUCTED A FULL INVESTIGATION AND FOUND THAT (1) ALL PAPERWORK WAS IN ORDER, (2) THE REP HAD FULL DISCRETIONARY AUTHORITY, (3) CUSTOMER WAS REQUIRED TO PUT ALL RESTRICTIONS IN WRITING AND HE DID NOT PUT ANY IN WRITING, (4) THE REP HAD CONTACTED THE CUSTOMER 34 TIMES BETWEEN WHEN THE SUPPOSED RESTRICTION WAS ISSUED AND WHEN THE COMPLAINT WAS MADE AND NO RESTRICTION WAS NEVER MENTIONED WHILE NUMEROUS TRADES WERE MADE IN THE ACCOUNT, AND (5) WHILE THE ACCOUNT LOST MONEY, THE LOSS WAS LESS THAN THAT OF THE S&P500 IN A HISTORY-MAKING DOWNWARD MARKET.  BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE INVESTIGATION, THE FIRM FOUND NO BASIS FOR THE CUSTOMER'S CLAIM AND THEREFORE IT WAS DENIED."
}
